intro: Anemia donnell-smithii, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is adapted to harsh desert conditions, featuring succulent leaves that store water and reduce transpiration. It produces small, fleshy berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Anemia donnell-smithii is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in full sun with minimal water.
